Player History
Drafted in 7th round, 124th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1970...
Traded from Minnesota to Detroit on 2/13/1970 (Going to MIN: LF T. Poquette. Going to DET: LF G. Hiser)...
Injured on 5/9/1976 with a Bruised Foot, out for 3 days...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1977, off Burt Hooton (BAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/24/1977, off Marty Pattin (OAK)...
Injured on 8/11/1980 with a Bruised Foot, out for one week...
Injured on 6/9/1981 with a Bruised Ulna, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Baltimore on 7/20/1981...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1981...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 4/18/1983 to a 1-year deal worth $1,336,000 per year...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1983...
Signed as a free agent by California on 2/1/1985 to a 3-year deal worth $999,999 per year...
Injured on 5/13/1985 with a Inflamed Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 5-6 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Baltimore on 7/9/1985...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1986...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/22/1988 to a 3-year deal worth $2,600,000 per year...
